intro: Hieracium canoviridiceps, commonly known as the green-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium canoviridiceps is a perennial species that is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
